Fig.16. Portion of the ovarium so folded as to have its inner 
membrane (a) outward 
- 17. sectional view of the ovarium. (a) inner (b) outer membrane 
c. ovum. s. germinal vesicle. e. ger<sup>l<\sup>. spot. 
<u>Phacellophora<\u> - ? 
Fig. 18. View of a segment of the under surface - a. marginal 
vesicles. b. tentacles in this individual very much shorter 
than usual - c. ovary or testis - d. Buccal membrane 
- 18a. Vertical section 
- 19. Tentcle 
- 20. Portion of the Buccal membrane. 20a. round processes 
containing thread cells scattered over its outer surface 
- 21. Portion of the testis - a. generative tentacles 
- 22. Sectional view of part of the testis - a. outer membrane 
b. sperm sacs - c. inner membrane 
- 23. Stages of development of the Spermatozoa ([paragraph] 45.) 
- 24. Ovarium. a. outer membrane - b. ova. c. inner m. 
25. Marginal Vesicle from the under surface - a. dilatatio[n] 
of the canal. 
25a. Marginal vesicle and pedicle very much enlarged 
<u>Rhizostoma mosaica<\u> 
Fig. 26. View of the under surface of the disc <s>of<\s> the Brachiferous 
plate being cut away - a. Marginal vesicle. b. cut 
extremity of the suspending pillar of the brachiferous plate 
c- central crura - d. lateral crura. generative folds 
f. connecting membrane.
